intro.description:
In this tutorial, you learn how to configure an external editor and how to edit a component in the external editor. To follow this tutorial, you must have an external editor installed in your computer.
If the views you need to perform this tutorial are not visible, select Window -> Show View and select the view you want.
Follow the tutorial steps in order. After each step, move to the next step by clicking the button located at the bottom of the step: Click to Perform (if you want the step to be performed automatically), Click to Skip (if you want to perform the step manually) or Click to Complete (if no automatisation is available). If you do not use the buttons to move between steps, the automated tutorial functions become inavailable. To start this tutorial, click the Click to Begin button below.

item.title: Create a new theme.
item.description: In the menu bar, select File -> Create New Theme. A New Theme window opens. In the Theme name field, enter Tutorial2. Click Finish. Click Click to Perform to create a new Theme automatically.

item.title: Configure the external vector editor.
item.description: Select Window -> Preferences -> Carbide.ui -> External Tools. In the Vector Editor field, select Browse and browse to your preferred vector editor. Click OK.

item.title: Select the Pinboard screen for editing.
item.description: In the Gallery view, select the Pinboard screen from the drop-down menu.

item.title: Select the Notepad Shortcut icon for editing.
item.description: In the Editor, highlight the Notepad Shortcut icon, right-click it and select Edit Image in Vector editor. The external editor opens.

item.title: Edit the Notepad Shortcut icon in the external vector editor.
item.description: Edit the Notepad Shortcut icon and save it. Go back to Carbide.ui. The component is automatically updated according to the changes you made in the external editor.

item.title: Save the theme under a different name.
item.description: Select File -> Save As. Enter a name (Vector Tutorial) for the copy. Select the default location and click OK.
